p: The anticancer efficacy of increasing concentrations of AG-ME on MCF-7, A-549, and HeLa cells was also evaluated by NRU assay. The results are presented in Figure 4. As shown in the figure, the percent viability of MCF-7 cells was recorded as 14%, 23%, 36%, 54%, 75%, and 85% at 1000, 500, 250, 100, 50, and 25 μg/ml of AG-ME, respectively ( Figure 4(a)). The viability of A-549 cells was decreased from 89% to 21% between 25 and 1000 μg/ml of AG-ME ( Figure 4(b)); however, the viability of HeLa cells was decreased from 95% to 29% between 25 and 1000 μg/ml of AG-ME ( Figure 4(c)). Similar to MTT assay, MCF-7 cells were more sensitive towards AG-ME followed by A-549 and HeLa cells by NRU assay. The IC 50 values by NRU assay were 109 μg/ml, 250 μg/ml, and 312 μg/ml for MCF-7, A-549, and HeLa cells, respectively ( Table 2).
